sanskrit_verse:
कामक्रोधौ तु संयम्य योऽर्थान् धर्मेण पश्यति ।
प्रजास्तमनुवर्तन्ते समुद्रमिव सिन्धवः ॥ ८.१७५॥
transliteration:
kāmakrodhau tu saṃyamya yo'rthān dharmeṇa paśyati |
prajāstamanuvartante samudramiva sindhavaḥ || 8.175||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who restrains desire and anger, and perceives material ends through the lens of Dharma, becomes followed by subjects as rivers flow into the ocean.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from self-regulation and alignment with Dharma
Causation flows from inner governance to outer sovereignty
Capacity-based responsibility is rooted in mastery over instinctual impulses
Restoration logic operates through conscious modeling and collective resonance
Consciousness alignment determines societal harmony and leadership legitimacy
executable_legal_axioms: IF ruler exhibits restraint in kama-krodha THEN legitimacy score = MAX
IF subject behavior mirrors ruler restraint THEN social cohesion index increases
IF policy decisions reflect dharmic perception THEN compliance rate = AUTOMATIC
IF emotional regulation capacity >= THRESHOLD THEN authority recognition = TRUE
IF action aligns with sequential dharma THEN consequence propagation = harmonious integration
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating executive conduct, the Supreme Court must evaluate not punitive violations but the degree of alignment between leadership actions and dharmic perceptual clarity. The threshold of responsibility lies in whether the leader demonstrates mastery over desire and anger, thereby establishing causal legitimacy for societal adherence.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality establishes that when a ruler's vision is aligned with Dharma, praja naturally follow, like rivers merging into the sea. This sequence (anupurvasah) reflects proportional responsibility where leadership integrity generates voluntary alignment rather than enforced compliance. There is no punitive mechanism—only natural law manifesting through consciousness coherence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Ruler Consciousness Alignment Process to restore perceptual clarity
Deploy Subject Resonance Harmonization Protocol to recalibrate collective response
Activate Emotional Mastery Restoration Circuit within governing bodies
Engage Dharmic Perception Calibration Sequence to realign material objectives
Execute Voluntary Compliance Amplification Loop through demonstrated self-governance
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. Justice executed through consciousness restoration, not punishment. Reality affirmed as non-punitive. Dharma re-established. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
